videoSnippet.title: Dance of the Knights || A-Major Upset || Capablanca vs Sergei Prokofiev
videoSnippet.description:
Read Sergei Prokofiev's Journal here http://www.sprkfv.net/journal/three02/thegame2.html

Listen to Sergei Prokofiev here and get in the mood for the game game https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3E9tN3vnyf4

Watch Capablanca Saga from the beginning here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=64Po0qJqHFU&list=PLDnx7w_xuguH7szQrhNeLKoBZm-8Pumfq

Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Jose Raul Capablanca vs Sergei Prokofiev
"A-Major Upset" 
Simul, 27b (1914), St. Petersburg RUE, May-29 
Queen Pawn Game: Symmetrical Variation (D02)

1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. c4 Bf5 4. Qb3 Nc6 5. Qb7 Na5 6. Qa6 Nc4 7. Nc3 e6 8. e4 de4 9. Bc4 ef3 10. Qc6 Nd7 11. g4 Bg6 12. Bg5 Be7 13. Be7 Ke7 14. O-O-O Re8 15. h4 h5 16. gh5 Bh5 17. Nb5 Kf8 18. d5 Qf6 19. de6 Ne5 20. Qc5 Kg8 21. ef7 Bf7 22. Bf7 Qf7 23. Kb1 Rab8 24. Nc7 Rbc8 25. Rc1 Re7 26. Qd6 Rec7 27. Rc7 Qc7 28. Qe6 Kh8 29. a3 Qc2 30. Ka1 Nd3 31. Rb1 Nf2 32. h5 Qc6 33. Qf5 Ne4 34. Qf3 Nd2 35. Qc6 Rc6 36. Rd1 Rc2 37. Rg1 Rc5 38. Rg6 Rh5 39. Ra6 Nb3 40. Ka2 Ra5 41. Ra5 Na5 42. b4 g5 43. Kb2 g4

In the evening once again to the Chess Tournament, to play Capablanca.
     The game began like yesterday but things were a bit tougher – Capablanca didn’t lose the exchange but he didn’t win any pieces. He attacked, which made things very difficult for me but I resisted energetically. Capablanca moved his other pieces with style, leaving them open to attack but just try and take them and you’ll lose. Budarina, in a terrible state, was on my right; on my left, Iakhontov, Bashkirov’s beau-frère, ever the impeccable gentleman. After two hours of hard play, I suddenly saw a combination and said to Iakhontov: “I’m going to win the game”.

Sergei Prokofiev

To those of you who read the description: You are an excellent subscriber! :)
